attributes.description: Conservative 4-week block focusing on the four main powerlifts (deadlift, squat, bench press, push press) with max testing in week 4 to establish new baselines. Program respects limited recovery capacity (6-hour sleep, high work stress) with 2.5-5lb weekly progression.
attributes.name: 4-Week Strength Testing Block

phases.description: Build work capacity and refine technique on main lifts with moderate volume and intensity. Focus on movement quality and establishing consistent execution patterns.
phases.name: Volume Accumulation

phases.description: Transition to higher intensity with reduced volume. Prepare nervous system for maximal loads while managing fatigue accumulation.
phases.name: Intensity Transition

phases.description: Systematic deload early in week followed by max testing on all four lifts to establish new baselines. Minimal volume to ensure full recovery before testing.
phases.name: Max Testing & Deload

trainingGoals: Test current max on back squat (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on bench press (baseline: 255x3)
Test current max on push press (baseline: 165x3)
Establish new training baselines for future programming
Improve shoulder and upper back mobility through consistent warm-up work
Maintain conditioning capacity with finishers and one longer session weekly
